I get mine on the side and eat it with the accompanying grilled pita bread.  My husband's fav are the chicken wings cooked in the pizza oven and covered with roasted onions and accompanied by grilled pita bread... No sauce necessary as he says they are tasty "as is".  For dinner I love the house salad with Gorgonzola  and we share a cauliflower pizza.  The crust is regular crust and it is topped with roasted cauliflower covered with a blanket of roasted garlic, salt and olive oil and mozzarella cheese.  Sometimes, I just drive by to take out the cauliflower pizza and the meatballs in a pan at the Weston location.  Choices of wine are normal and consistent with this type of eatery.  Choices of Beer are far superior to wine.  The only complaint I have is that the portions seem to be getting smaller.  The luncheon salad and tuna we had yesterday and 10 days ago were about at least a third smaller than over the past few years...  I recommend Anthony's for their menu and casual, comfortable environment with tasty food.

name: Howard H
text:
Do you know what I hate the most?  Do you know what really gets under my skip?  That is to see business making false/misleading/dishonest/deceitful advertisements.  You can provide a great service or product, but if you are being deceitful to your customers, you'll not get my business...you know what they say, Fool me once, shame on you, fool me twice, shame on me.

That's is what I find my self in Anthony's Coal Fire Pizza in Weston today.  We have visited Anthony's in other locations before, and had received good food and services.  So today after my car was finished being serviced, we thought we visit this location for lunch in this location for the first time.

And yes, the wings tasted just as good as other locations, and so were the meatballs.  I noticed on the wall which wrote "Local Craft $4.00".  Well, that sounds like a good deal.  I will have a Funky Buddha.

To my surprise when I got my bill, I noticed that they charged me $6.00 on the beer.  I asked the bartender why I was charged $6.00 for a beer brewed locally.  The answer I got was: oh, we don't consider that beer local!.

What?  Did I hear you right?  If Funky Buddha isn't local, what are your local beers for $4.00.  Ready for the answer I received?  Yuengling!!!  Yes, beers from Pennsylvania they consider local but beers from Boca are not.

I know you may say what's the big deal, its only $2.00 different.  But, I think the picture is much bigger than just $2.00.  If they can be dishonest in $2.00 about the beers, imagine what else they are being dishonest to you about.  You can order a nice glass of red wine and you may ended up with a house wine.  You may be ordering a nice pot of meatballs, but you could end up with reheated frozen meatballs .  And why would you want to support  a business who is making misleading advertising to lure customers in and then lied about it.  That to me is a big NO NO!  Thanks Anthony's.   You just don't do it for me anymore.

Love all of Anthony's locations! We were so happy when they opened out in Weston as it's close to our house. We pop in for a quick lunch or dinner quite often.
I wanna give management kuddos as they run a tight ship but what's most impressive is that they work. They are right in the thick of things taking orders, packing food, seating, managing the restaurant and even opening the door for customers! Great leadership!

The place is always clean and the staff is friendly but the food, omg the food! To die for!

My musts: Eggplant Marino
Large salad with gorgonzola cheese
Wings
All of their food from pizza to dishes is delish.

A must try!
